intro: Oreodaphne verruculosa, commonly known as the rough-leafed daphne, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and hill forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in tropical ecosystems.
